content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    code_blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, capture=2))
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks with a newline
    joined_code = join([replace(block, "`" => "") for block in code_blocks], "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all occurrences of Julia code blocks (```julia\n(.*?)\n```) and collects the content of these blocks into an array. It then removes the code fences from each block (replaces "`" with "") and joins them together with a newline character "\n".

Please note that this function assumes that all code blocks are correctly formatted as ```julia\n(.*?)\n```. If there are any irregularities in your markdown document, you might need to adjust the regular expression accordingly.
